item.title: How To Watch the 2025 Copa Libertadores Final: Palmeiras vs. Flamengo
item.dc:creator: Taylor Kujawa
item.description:
The 2025 Copa Libertadores final kicks off on November 29. Our guide covers how to watch Palmeiras vs. Flamengo live on U.S. TV channels and streaming options.

The post How To Watch the 2025 Copa Libertadores Final: Palmeiras vs. Flamengo appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
South American club football reaches its absolute peak on Saturday, November 29. The 2025 Copa Libertadores final features a heavyweight showdown between Palmeiras and Flamengo, live from the Estadio Monumental in Lima, Peru.

With continental domination on the line, you can expect this to be a hard-fought battle by two clubs whose rivalry has only intensified in recent years. Both Palmeiras and Flamengo have won this trophy three times, and the winner of this edition will become the most decorated Brazilian club in the tournament’s history. As if that wasn’t enough, it’s a rematch of the 2021 final that saw Palmeiras win in extra time.

For fans in the U.S., finding this game on TV can be a challenge. You won’t see it on your local channels or the main ESPN or FOX networks. To help you get ready for the opening whistle, I’ve broken down exactly where to tune in and the best ways to stream it live.

2025 Copa Libertadores Final

Matchup: Palmeiras vs. Flamengo
Date: Saturday, Nov. 29
Time: 4:00 p.m. ET
Channels: beIN SPORTS, beIN SPORTS en Español

Stream Free on Fubo

Get your TV set for kickoff!

You won’t want to miss this electrifying CONMEBOL club final. Enter your zip code below to see your local internet and TV provider options.

What U.S. channel has the Copa Libertadores final?

You can watch the 2025 Copa Libertadores final live on beIN SPORTS in the U.S. Meanwhile, the Spanish-language broadcast will be on beIN SPORTS en Español. Both channels will have complete pre- and post-game coverage.

Best TV plans for watching the Copa Libertadores final

The biggest hurdle for U.S. fans watching the Copa Libertadores final is that its exclusive home, beIN SPORTS, is notoriously hard to get. As I’ve found in my provider research, many of the most popular live TV services don’t even carry the channel. To solve that problem, I’ve analyzed over 13 TV providers to find the best (and cheapest) ways to get the channel in time for this month’s final.

Best overall: Fubo

Fubo is the best and most straightforward option for watching the Copa Libertadores final. The main reason is that you get beIN SPORTS in its standard Pro plan, so you don’t have to hunt for a special add-on. This one subscription also gets you a ton of other must-have sports channels (like ESPN, FS1, and CBS Sports Network) and unlimited cloud DVR storage.

Now, let’s talk about the price, which is the main downside. Fubo is a premium service, and even if you get a sign-up deal, you must factor in taxes and the dreaded regional sports fee. That fee can add up to $16.99 a month, depending on your location, which is a hefty hidden cost. It’s a fantastic, all-in-one service, but that extra fee is a tough pill to swallow.

View Fubo Plans

Cheapest: Sling TV

For the most affordable way to watch Copa Libertadores matches, I recommend Sling TV. The live TV streaming service offers a standalone Soccer Pass subscription for just $7.99 a month. This gets you every beIN SPORTS channel to see the Flamengo–Palmeiras final, plus other tournaments like the Copa Sudamericana.

I’ve always appreciated Sling TV because it’s a basic, no-frills service that just works. It doesn’t have many flashy features, but in my own testing, I’ve always had a smooth live stream experience. If you just want the Copa final without a complicated, expensive package, this is the most cost-effective route.

View Sling TV Plans

Niche alternative: Fanatiz

If you’re a die-hard South American fútbol fan who doesn’t care for a comprehensive live TV plan, then Fanatiz is another direct option. This is a bare-bones streaming service built specifically for soccer lovers. To watch the Copa Libertadores final, you must navigate its confusing packages and find the Front Row Monthly plan ($12.99/mo.), which includes beIN SPORTS programming.

Unfortunately, Fanatiz is a classic “you get what you pay for” experience. I find the app and website interface to be pretty messy and sometimes glitchy, which is frustrating during live events. Still, it’s compatible with major devices like Amazon Fire TV, Apple TV, and Roku.

View Fanatiz Plans

How to watch the Copa Libertadores final for free

Since the game is on a premium channel, your only (legal) free option is to use a live TV streaming service free trial.

My top recommendation is Fubo’s five-day free trial, as its Pro and Elite plans include beIN SPORTS. If you time it right, you can sign up on Black Friday, watch the final on Saturday, and still have a few days to explore the service before your time’s up. That’ll keep you busy with all the major TV events happening over Thanksgiving weekend.

International broadcast details for the Copa Libertadores final

For international fans, Copa Libertadores broadcast rights vary by country since CONMEBOL sells them in separate packages worldwide. This means you can find the final on popular platforms in many countries, from free-to-air channels in Brazil to dedicated TV services across the globe.

To help you find your local feed, I’ve compiled a brief overview of the official broadcasters in major countries.

Copa Libertadores final broadcasters by country

  • Argentina (ESPN, Disney+)
  • Australia (beIN SPORTS)
  • Brazil (Globoplay)
  • Canada (beIN SPORTS)
  • Chile (ESPN, Disney+)
  • Colombia (ESPN, Disney+)
  • Mexico (ESPN, Disney+)
  • Spain (LaLiga+)
  • United Kingdom (BBC iPlayer)
  • United States (beIN SPORTS)

How to watch the Copa Libertadores final FAQ

What is the Copa Libertadores?

The Copa Libertadores is the largest club soccer tournament in South America. Organized by CONMEBOL, it's the equivalent of Europe's UEFA Champions League, and the winner qualifies for the FIFA Club World Cup.

Who is playing in the 2025 Copa Libertadores final?

This year's Copa Libertadores final is an all-Brazilian matchup between SE Palmeiras of São Paulo and CR Flamengo of Rio de Janeiro. Both teams compete in the Campeonato Brasileiro Série A.

What time does the Copa Libertadores final start?

The 2025 final kicks off on Saturday, November 29, at 4:00 p.m. ET.

Can I watch the Copa Libertadores final on Paramount+?

No, Copa Libertadores games don't stream on Paramount+ in the U.S. Instead, you'll need access to beIN SPORTS.

How can I watch a replay of the Copa Libertadores final?

Most streaming services that carry beIN SPORTS will offer an on-demand replay, especially live TV services with DVR capabilities. You can also catch free highlights and clips on the CONMEBOL Libertadores and beIN SPORTS USA YouTube channels.

Game day starts here!

  • How To Watch the Premier League
  • Best Streaming Services for Sports

item.title: How To Watch the 2025 MLS Playoffs
item.dc:creator: Taylor Kujawa
item.description:
It’s survival of the fittest as Major League Soccer (MLS) clubs fight for a place in the MLS Cup Final. The MLS Playoffs will air on MLS Season Pass and FOX Sports networks starting in October, with the grand finale in December.

The post How To Watch the 2025 MLS Playoffs appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Stream on MLS Season Pass

I know some people out there think Major League Soccer (MLS) is the annoying stepchild of European soccer. But if you ask me, it’s the playoffs when these talented players really shine.

It’s survival of the fittest as clubs fight for a place in the 2025 MLS Cup Final. The MLS Playoffs will air on MLS Season Pass and FOX Sports networks from October to December, with the grand finale on Saturday, December 6.

This season, the playoffs continue last year’s format of 18 playoff teams. The top seven clubs from the Eastern and Western Conferences qualify for Round One, while the eighth and ninth seeds from each conference must first battle it out in the Wild Card Round.

Keep reading to see what specific channels you’ll need to watch the playoffs and how you can tune in for free.

Jump to:

  • MLS Playoffs channels
  • MLS Playoffs schedule
  • Watch the MLS Playoffs for free

Score the best TV provider in your area

Don’t miss a single minute of the MLS Playoffs. Enter your zip code below to see the top TV providers available for your home.

What channels are the MLS Playoffs on?

The 2025 MLS Playoffs will stream on MLS Season Pass, with select broadcasts airing on FOX and FS1. MLS Season Pass features English- and Spanish-language commentary, but Fox Deportes also shows playoff games en Español.

Pro tip: International MLS fans can watch the MLS Playoffs on MLS Season Pass, while select games will also air on TSN and RDS in Canada.

MLS Playoffs TV schedule

The 2025 MLS Playoffs begin with wild card matches on Wednesday, October 22, after what will surely be an exhilarating Decision Day on Saturday, October 18. As usual, the playoffs will feature intense action that culminates in the MLS Cup Final—set for Saturday, December 6.

I’ve laid out the TV schedule below for viewing details on all the playoff matches. I’ll update it with teams and times as more information becomes available.

Best TV plans for watching the MLS Playoffs

For my money, MLS Season Pass on Apple TV is the best way to watch the 2025 MLS Playoffs. At $14.99 a month or $9.99 for the remainder of the season, it’s an inexpensive viewing option for anyone with reliable internet. You also get in-depth studio coverage and on-demand access to every game—a great feature if you can’t tune in live.

If you prefer a more comprehensive TV provider, we recommend Hulu + Live TV because it comes with every FOX Sports channel and ESPN+. That’ll get you select MLS playoff games and live coverage of many other soccer leagues—including the German Bundesliga, La Liga, and the USL Championship. You’ll even get complete access to other marquee soccer tournaments like the NWSL Playoffs and FIFA Club World Cup.

How to watch the MLS Playoffs for free

Get free local channels
Editorial rating (4.5/5)
Recommended antenna:
Mohu Leaf 50 ($46.99, one-time purchase‡)
MLS Playoffs channels:
FOX
Features:
All local broadcast channels
View on Amazon
Read Mohu Leaf review

CableTV.com utilizes paid Amazon links. Amazon.com Price; $46.99 (as of 7/25/25 11:20 a.m. CT). Read full disclaimer.

There’s no way to watch the entire MLS Playoffs for free. But some playoff games air on FOX, which is free to access if you live near a local network affiliate. You only need an over-the-air (OTA) antenna that’s strong enough to pick up the channel’s signal. Then, you’ll get every matchup on FOX—including the MLS Cup Final—without paying a monthly subscription.

Of course, the antenna itself isn’t free. But it’s a one-time purchase that will last several seasons and provide live sports year-round—including MLB, NFL, and Premier League games.

We recommend the Mohu Leaf 50 because its 60-mile range and included amplifier are ideal for clear channel reception. But you’ll first want to enter your zip code on the FCC’s Reception Map Tool to confirm a FOX affiliate is within range of your home.

If you require a wider-range antenna, visit our Best Antennas for Cord-Cutters page for more recommendations.

How to watch the MLS Playoffs FAQ

What channel is the MLS Cup Playoffs on?

The MLS Playoffs stream entirely on MLS Season Pass. But select playoff games also air on FOX Sports channels in the U.S., while TSN and RDS networks show some playoff matchups in Canada.

Where can I stream the MLS Playoffs?

You can stream every MLS playoff game on MLS Season Pass via the Apple TV app. Live TV streaming services that carry FOX and FS1 also provide access to select MLS games.

Does ESPN+ have the MLS Playoffs?

No, ESPN+ doesn’t have live MLS playoff games. Instead, you’ll need an MLS Season Pass subscription to stream the complete MLS Cup Playoffs.

Does Apple TV have the MLS Playoffs?

Yes, you can watch the MLS Playoffs on Apple TV with an MLS Season Pass add-on subscription. Select playoff games may also stream on Apple TV+.

Why you should trust us

Our CableTV.com sports editor, Taylor Kujawa, examined the best ways to watch the MLS Playoffs by comparing the prices and channel offerings of the most popular TV services. He selected his English- and Spanish-language viewing recommendations based on convenience—focusing on channel availability, pricing, and ease of signing up.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

Game day starts here!

item.title: Best College Football Games Today on TV | Week 12 2025
item.dc:creator: Eric Chiu
item.description:
Don’t miss a snap! Find the full Week 12 schedule for watching college football today on TV. We cover channel lineups and which games are must-watch matchups.

The post Best College Football Games Today on TV | Week 12 2025 appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Watch College Football Free on Fubo

We’re all tired of hearing the headlines about the standoff between those two groups. They’re holding off, refusing to come to the table, and making things worse for everyone involved!

But at CableTV.com, we try to be optimistic about these sorts of things. And after a weekend that featured the most unlikely of unlikely scenarios—we saw last-second wins, a Curt Cignetti smile, and whatever Wisconsin–Washington was—who’s to say we can’t get YouTube TV and ESPN back to the bargaining table? (Was there another long-running and stupid dispute in the news that we missed?)

For the Week 12 edition of the CableTV.com College Football What To Watch Guide, we’ll appreciate Mess, try to believe the hype, and explore Guy-ology.

Jump to:

  • CableTV.com’s Game of the Week
  • Week 12’s best college football games
  • College football Week 12 TV schedule

Interested in college football games today?

Subscribe to our email newsletter for the latest football takes, TV subscription deals, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

CableTV.com’s Expert Viewing Guide: Still can’t watch college football games because of YouTube TV and ESPN’s blackout dispute?

Check out our main How to Stream College Football guide to find the easiest and free YouTube TV alternatives to watch college football games this Saturday. We also cover popular YouTube TV streaming alternatives like Fubo, Sling, and DIRECTV.

CableTV.com’s college football Game of the Week

Watch Texas vs. Georgia | ABC

Why you should watch: Much like Arch Manning’s per-game quarterback rating, the discourse around Texas has been swinging up and down all season. And just like that one annoying Kill Tony guy you know who moved to Austin and got really into crypto, the top-10 Longhorns are back up this weekend.

Week 10’s 34–31 win over Vanderbilt was Manning’s best conference game of the season, as he threw for more than 300 yards alongside three touchdowns and no picks. Texas’ retooled offensive line also kept Manning upright and powered running back Quintrevion Wisner to his best performance (75 yards at 4.2 yards per attempt and a touchdown) since the Red River Rivalry.

WINGO GOT WHEELS 💨‼️ pic.twitter.com/2jGA7HiPvJ

— Texas Football (@TexasFootball) November 1, 2025

That said, Texas’s win streak has coincided with Steve Sarkisian laying off the play-calling pedal. As noted by Burnt Orange Nation and Saturday Down South, Texas has heavily relied on the screen and YAC game over its four-game win streak—most of Manning’s yardage against Vanderbilt came after the catch and they’ve dialed back their downfield passing attempts considerably.

Can this year’s rickety edition of Georgia force Texas to not be screen merchants? Those TikToks of Kirby Smart dog-cussing at practice finally paid off with a vintage 41–21 bulldozing of Mississippi State last weekend—Georgia’s secondary didn’t allow a touchdown, and their ground game cracked 300 yards for the first time this season. To keep their playoff hopes alive, Texas will need a complete game from Manning and enough defensive juice to hold Georgia’s passing game in check.

How to watch #10 Texas at #5 Georgia

vs.

Date: Saturday, Nov. 15
Time: 7:30 p.m. ET
Channel: ABC
Location: Sanford Stadium in Athens, GA
Point spread: Georgia by 6.5

Stream on Fubo

CableTV.com’s Homefield Apparel of the week

Based in Indianapolis, Homefield offers officially licensed college apparel with exclusive vintage designs that draw from the history of more than 150 colleges. This week’s Homefield picks highlight vault pulls, bomber jackets, and more from Homefield’s Georgia and Texas collections.

Want to upgrade your gameday fit? Click the link below to check out Homefield’s collections, and use promo code CABLETV to save 15% off your first order.

Buy Homefield College Football Shirts

CableTV.com’s top college football games for Week 12

Watch Ohio vs. Western Michigan | ESPN2
Watch Buffalo vs. Central Michigan | CBS Sports Network

Why you should watch: Feel the MACtion this week with a solid matchup slate featuring teams at the top of the MAC conference standings.

The 6–1 Bobcats are sitting pretty with a three-game win streak, and they’ll head to Kalamazoo to face a Broncos team coming off a good win over Central Michigan. Up the road in Mount Pleasant, the Chips are narrowly favored over a Bulls team that rebounded from an Akron upset with a blowout win over Bowling Green.

How to watch Ohio at Western Michigan

 vs.  

Date: Tuesday, Nov. 11
Time: 8:00 p.m. ET
Channel: ESPN2
Location: Waldo Stadium in Kalamazoo, MI
Point spread: Ohio by 1.5

How to watch Buffalo at Central Michigan

 vs. 

Date: Wednesday, Nov. 12
Time: 7:00 p.m. ET
Channel: CBS Sports Network
Location: Kelly/Shorts Stadium in Mount Pleasant, MI
Point spread: CMU by 2.5

Stream on DIRECTV

Watch West Virginia vs. Arizona State | TNT, truTV, HBO Max

Why you should watch: RichRod teams have typically hit another gear when they’ve found their dual-threat guy. 2024 Jacksonville State’s Tyler Huff was the latest in a proud lineage of RichRod Guys like Pat White, Denard Robinson, and Khalil Tate.

We’re not yet ready to declare West Virginia quarterback Scotty Fox Jr. the latest RichRod Guy, but since taking over under center, he’s put up strong Guy-Adjacent stat lines. In wins over Houston and Colorado, Fox cracked the 50-yard mark on the ground and showed a wily amount of speed.

I see your Mason Heintschel and raise you one Scotty Fox. #HailWV 🏈 https://t.co/UUuUJHt9GQ pic.twitter.com/ngVAGEVrkj

— The Beard 🕶️🎙️ ☕️ (@EerBeard) November 2, 2025

At 4–6 with a season-ending matchup against Texas Tech awaiting them, West Virginia’s likely focusing on next year over a long-shot bowl bid. But Fox could potentially make things interesting against a Sun Devils squad that started Jeff Sims at quarterback last week and still eked out a win.

How to watch West Virginia at Arizona State

vs.

Date: Saturday, Nov. 15
Time: 1:00 p.m. ET
Channel: TNT, truTV, HBO Max
Location: Mountain America Stadium in Tempe, AZ
Point spread: Arizona State by 10.5

Stream on DIRECTV

Watch Oklahoma vs. Alabama | ABC

Why you should watch: John Mateer booked his postseason reservations, and he’ll be damned if he has to call customer service and wait for a refund.

Mateer’s productivity has fallen off since he returned against Texas, but thanks to the Sooners defense, an improving group of running backs, and run game usage that hasn’t yet cleaved him in half (Mateer’s, somehow, tied for first in carries), the 7–2 Sooners are still holding onto the playoff bubble.

The odds are stacked against Oklahoma for the upset, as they’ll head to Tuscaloosa for this year’s matchup. But if they can sneak by Alabama—who has alternated between methodical dispatches and narrow wins all season, if you’re looking to wishcast—the Sooners close out the year with winnable games against Mizzou and the dried husk of LSU.

How to watch #11 Oklahoma at #4 Alabama

 vs.

Date: Saturday, Nov. 15
Time: 3:30 p.m. ET
Channel: ABC
Location: Bryant-Denny Stadium in Tuscaloosa, AL
Point spread: Alabama by 7.5

Stream on DIRECTV

Watch South Florida vs. Navy | ESPN2
Watch Virginia vs. Duke | ESPN2

Why you should watch: If your school’s conference begins with the letter A, be prepared to bookmark win scenario spreadsheets and pop some aspirin this month.

Down in the American, Memphis all but fell out of the conference title race after their loss to Tulane last week. South Florida and Navy face off this week for the chance to grab first place on the American standings, and the Bulls need a win to hold off Tulane for a spot in the conference title game. (This applies double for 6–3 East Carolina, who’s technically part of the American’s four-way tie for second place and has the chance to do the funniest thing.)

Up in the ACC, Playoff Iowa may have died on the vine last weekend, but it doesn’t mean we can’t move on to our new wish: 7–5 Duke reaching the ACC title game! Despite dropping games to teams like Georgia Tech and UConn, the Blue Devils still have a viable path to Charlotte.

Here is the incredibly realistic scenario where Duke goes 7-5 and makes it to the ACC title game.

The only notable upset required is Virginia Tech beating Virginia.


— Ryan McCrystal (@ryanmccrystal.bsky.social) November 10, 2025 at 1:31 PM

Duke ends the year with winnable games against UNC and Wake Forest and has second place to themselves on the conference standings. Coupled with other ACC contenders like Georgia Tech and Pitt facing off and picking themselves off in the coming weeks, Duke simply needs a few breaks to be the last man standing—ESPN’s FPI even gives them the second-best odds of winning the conference title.

If that wasn’t enough, they’ll face off against a reeling Cavs team that just picked up its first conference loss and might not have quarterback Chandler Morris. The ACC might be a mid-filled disaster right now, but we’ll forgive them (and root for Duke, even!) if they can cause a Duke butterfly effect that gets James Madison into the playoffs. Playoff chaos!

How to watch South Florida at Navy

 vs.  

Date: Saturday, Nov. 15
Time: 12:00 p.m. ET
Channel: ESPN2
Location: Navy-Marine Corps Memorial Stadium in Annapolis, MD
Point spread: South Florida by 10.5

How to watch Virginia vs. Duke

 vs.

Date: Saturday, Nov. 15
Time: 3:30 p.m. ET
Channel: ESPN2
Location: Wallace Wade Stadium in Durham, NC
Point spread: Duke by 6.5

Stream on DIRECTV

Not sure what college football games are on TV today or tonight?

Every week, the CableTV.com editorial sports crew does all the research into game times and channel listings for every FBS college football game. From the ACC to the Sun Belt, you can trust that we’ll have the most accurate, trustworthy, and up-to-date college football schedule. We have the correct channels, matchups, and broadcast times, alongside the best streaming deals for the biggest college football matchups.

CableTV.com’s NBA expert maps out the weekly TV schedule and breaks down the top games, key player matchups, and storylines so you know exactly what to watch.

The post NBA Schedule This Week: Your Guide to the Best Week 4 Games on TV appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Most NBA teams have played 10 games at this point of the season, and I’m starting to get a good sense of which teams are real, and which ones aren’t.

The Detroit Pistons have taken the East by storm (more on that later), the Dallas Mavericks have been surprisingly bad, and it seems like the Oklahoma City Thunder are actually far-and-away favorites for a repeat title. I’m keeping an eye on these teams every week from now on.

If you’re an NBA devotee, here’s what you should be checking out during the fourth week of the 2025–2026 NBA season, and what I thought of some of last week’s action.

Jump to:

  • National NBA game of the week
  • NBA League Pass game of the week
  • NBA schedule this week
  • League news and analysis

National NBA game of the week

Los Angeles Lakers at Oklahoma City Thunder | ESPN

I’m probably gonna recommend the Thunder a lot this season. They’re the defending champs, and they just keep winning even though Jalen Williams hasn’t played due to his recovery from an offseason wrist surgery—which is delayed, by the way.

On the Lakers side, this game is an early measuring stick for how good the team can be. If they get blown out, it’ll be a step back on their journey to being a championship contender. But if they can hang, or even win, that would instill a ton of confidence in themselves and their fan base.

How to watch Los Angeles Lakers at Oklahoma City Thunder
Date:
Wednesday, Nov. 12
Time: 9:30 p.m. ET
National channel: ESPN
Location: Paycom Center, Oklahoma City, OK

Stream with DIRECTV

Honorable mention: 

  • Golden State Warriors at San Antonio Spurs — NBA Cup (Friday, Nov. 14, 9:30 p.m. ET, Amazon Prime Video).

NBA League Pass game of the week

Brooklyn Nets at Washington Wizards| NBA League Pass

I’m going unconventional this week and recommending a game between two very, very bad teams. Now, why is that? Why would I do that? (Insert Brian Windhorst meme here.)

Simple: Someone has to win.

Nobody wants to see a bad team play against a good or even a mid team—it’ll most likely end in a boring blowout. But two bad teams often make for great theater. All their frustrations over losing will get sorted out at the expense of one another. It’s a slugfest between teams that can’t do more than slap fight.

My NBA watching generally consists of two great teams (or my favorite team) going at it so I can get the best viewing experience possible.

On this night, I choose violence.

How to watch Brooklyn Nets at Washington Wizards
Date:
Sunday, Nov. 16
Time: 6:00 p.m. ET
Local channels: YES, Monumental Sports Network
Out-of-market: NBA League Pass
Location: Capital One Arena, Washington, DC

Try League Pass

Honorable mention:

Data effective as of post date.

Swishes and airballs: My hot takes from NBA Week 3

Lots to muse about from keeping up with the third week of the 2025–2026 NBA season. Giddy up.

Swish: The Mind the Game conversation among LeBron James, Steph Curry, and Steve Nash. I tend to ignore this podcast and kind of forget it exists. But because James and Curry were on it together, I fired this one up. And man, it was so interesting to hear these three men talk basketball and enjoy each other’s company.

I know it’s not a traditional medium for conversations with NBA players, but I suggest you make some time to listen. If you love the NBA and what these three players have meant to the game in the last 25 to 30 years, you won’t regret it. The link to Part 1 of the conversation is below.

Airball: Walker Kessler’s season-ending injury. The Utah Jazz were always going to suck this season, and everyone knows it’s because they’re in a multiyear rebuilding process *cough* tanking *cough*. But Kessler is a cool dude and a very talented young player. I personally know people who have been around him while covering the team, and I’ve heard nothing but great things. Plus, the Jazz have been kinda fun this season. So losing him is a huge blow.

Swish: LeBron James is close to returning. The Lakers announced on Thursday, November 6, that he was cleared for contact basketball activities and he would be reevaluated in one to two weeks. That timeline still puts James on track to return mid-November.

TBD: The Pistons so far. I don’t know what to make of this team. They’ve won six straight games, vaulting themselves to the top of the Eastern Conference standings. But the six teams they’ve beaten to get there have a combined record of 21–39.

Good teams beat the teams they’re supposed to, and Detroit has certainly done that. But I’m just not ready to anoint them quite yet. I need to see more wins against quality teams. Case in point: The Pistons’ last loss was to the Cavs.

NBA schedule this week FAQ

When does the NBA season end?

The 2025–2026 NBA season ends Sunday, April 12, 2026.

How many games are in an NBA season?

The NBA season officially has 82 games. But since the addition of the NBA Cup, that number is technically 83 for the two teams that advance to the championship game of that tournament. The championship game doesn’t count as a regular-season game.

When is the NBA trade deadline?

The NBA trade deadline for the 2025–2026 season is February 6, 2026, at 3:00 p.m. ET.

Where can I watch Inside the NBA?

Inside the NBA will air on ABC and ESPN throughout the season. It will also include the show’s signature pregame and halftime shows.

Why you should trust us

Our CableTV.com sports writer, Alex Vejar, is a passionate NBA fan who follows the league by watching multiple games per week. He analyzed the NBA schedule and made his viewing recommendations based on matchups, star power, style of play, and unique or interesting viewing experiences.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods for reviewing TV services.

item.content:encoded:
CableTV.com’s fall TV preview guide is here!

Embrace cozy season with the best fall TV! The TV experts at CableTV.com have curated a list of top fall TV shows to help you find something to binge-watch while the leaves drop.

New on TV this week

This week’s “What To Watch” picks include the 56th season of Sesame Street (Netflix, PBS), the second seasons of The Creep Tapes (Shudder) and Palm Royale (Apple TV), and the thriller The Beast in Me (Netflix).

We also recommend a Jonas Brothers Christmas special (Disney+), Richard Linklater’s Nouvelle Vague (Netflix), and Mr. K on video-on-demand (VOD). Let’s hit the couch!

Night owl? Peep what’s on late-night TV this week.

New on Apple TV+ this week

Palm Royale | Apple TV+ | Comedy, drama

Season 2 premiere, Wednesday, Nov. 12: The ultra-rich may be terrible to deal with in real life, but they’re endlessly entertaining in fiction. Kristen Wiig’s Apple TV dramedy is back with a deeper look into high-society scandals and schemes. Will Maxine lose herself on her quest to cross class lines?

Read Our Apple TV+ Review

Pro tip: Looking for more to watch? Check out Sophie Hastings’ article, October’s Netflix Recap: The 5 Shows I Couldn’t Stop Binge-Watching.

New on Netflix this week

The Beast in Me | Netflix | Drama, thriller

Limited series premiere, Thursday, Nov. 13: The Beast in Me is about a grieving writer named Aggie Wiggs (Claire Danes) who falls deep into the true crime rabbit hole—that is, investigating her suspiciously murder-y neighbor Nile Jarvis (Matthew Rhys). But is the beast in Nile or in Aggie? And how is Aggie Wiggs not a drag queen name?

Best Movies and Shows on Netflix

See what to watch this weekend on all platforms

Click on your favorite streaming service below to see new releases and classic recommendations from our TV critics.

New on Shudder this week

The Creep Tapes | Shudder | Horror, comedy

Season 2 premiere, Friday, Nov. 14: Mark Duplass is back as a weirdo serial killer (is there any other kind?) obsessed with filming his own misdeeds. Watch as he lures in would-be filmmakers David Dastmalchian, Katie Aselton, and Robert Longstreet in this show’s bloody second season.

Best Shudder Original Movies

New on Netflix this week

Nouvelle Vague | Netflix | Drama, comedy

Movie, Friday, Nov. 14: If you love cinematic history and movies about movies, you’ll love this one. This artsy, black-and-white French film reimagines Jean-Luc Godard’s Breathless as a “playful” comedy in what Netflix is billing as a “poignant love letter to cinema.”

Best Movies and Shows on Netflix

Want more new TV shows?

« Catch Up on the Best TV Shows of 2024
Discover the Best TV Shows of 2025 »

New on Disney+ this week

A Very Jonas Christmas Movie | Disney+ | Comedy, musical

Movie, Friday, Nov. 14: Have you ever seen Planes, Trains, and Automobiles? Have you ever wished it featured less Steve Martin and more 2000s teen heartthrobs? The Jo-Bros have you covered with this fictional account of the band’s Christmas adventures—much like the old Disney Channel show, Jonas.

Best Movies and Shows on Disney+

Looking for your next binge-watch?

« Binge an Entire Show This Weekend
Start a Classic Binge-Worthy Show »

New on Netflix this week

Sesame Street | Netflix, PBS | Kids, educational

Season premiere, Monday, Nov. 10: Sesame Street is back for its 56th season, and it belongs to the people once again! After Netflix bought the series from HBO, it returned distribution rights to PBS. That means you can watch new episodes for free on PBS the same day they air on Netflix.

Best Movies and Shows on Netflix

New movie releases available to rent/buy on VOD this week

Mr. K (2025) | Mystery, drama

The official blurb for this movie may call it “Kafkaesque,” but this Gen Z reporter knows what the genre is really called—“backrooms creepypasta.”

Okay, it’s a little more highbrow than that. In Mr. K, Crispin Glover plays a hapless magician who checks into a spooky old hotel. But when it’s time to leave, he has trouble finding the exit. Doors, walls, cupboards, and wardrobes—nothing in this hotel makes a lot of sense, least of all the people trapped there.

You can rent Mr. K from video-on-demand (VOD) outlets like Prime Video, Google Movies & TV, and Fandango at Home (formerly VUDU) as of Tuesday, Nov. 11.

item.title: How To Watch Hawaii Rainbow Warriors Football in 2025
item.dc:creator: Taylor Kujawa
item.description:
Ready to watch Hawaii football, even on the mainland? Our guide has the 2025 TV schedule, late-night kickoff times, and recommended streaming picks.

The post How To Watch Hawaii Rainbow Warriors Football in [current_date format="yy"] appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Stream Free on DIRECTV

Led by island legend and fourth-year head coach Timmy Chang, the Hawaii Rainbow Warriors are ready for another exciting season. The University of Hawai’i at Mānoa squad leverages its island-forged identity to create a notoriously difficult travel destination for rivals.

While they present a tough matchup at home, the Warriors are determined to improve on their 5–7 record from last season and achieve bowl eligibility in the competitive Mountain West Conference. I’m still skeptical they can pull it off, which makes this season a crucial test of the program’s upward trajectory.

Many Rainbow Warriors games will air across CBS Sports and FOX Sports channels, but the team’s Spectrum Sports media deal complicates matters. In this guide, I’ll cover the complete Hawaii football TV schedule and outline the best viewing options so you don’t miss a game.

Jump to:

  • Hawaii football TV schedule
  • Best Hawaii football TV plans

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event-viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

2025 Hawaii football TV schedule

The Hawaii Rainbow Warriors get a head start on the 2025 season, kicking things off with a Week 0 matchup on August 23. This year, the team will play in at least five nationally televised matchups. This welcome visibility will make it easier for fans across the mainland, like this Wisconsinite, to follow the Warriors as they navigate a challenging slate.

Mountain West Conference play introduces Hawaii’s defining challenge: geography. The team’s success hinges on its ability to manage long road trips and protect its home-field advantage. You can find all the details in the complete 2025 TV schedule below, featuring updated channel listings and start times.

Opponent Day Time (ET)/Result Channel
Stanford Cardinal Saturday, Aug. 23 W 23–20 CBS, Paramount+ Premium
At Arizona Wildcats Saturday, Aug. 30 L 6–40 TNT, HBO Max
Sam Houston Bearkats Saturday, Sept. 6 W 37–20 Spectrum Sports, MW App
Portland State Vikings Saturday, Sept. 13 W 23–3 Spectrum Sports, MW App
Fresno State Bulldogs Saturday, Sept. 20 L 21–23 Spectrum Sports, MW App
At Air Force Falcons Saturday, Sept. 27 W 44–35 FS1
Utah State Aggies Saturday, Oct. 11 W 44–26 Spectrum Sports, MW App
At Colorado State Rams Saturday, Oct. 18 W 31–19 Spectrum Sports, MW App
At San José State Spartans Saturday, Nov. 1 L 38–45 CBS Sports Network
San Diego State Aztecs Saturday, Nov. 8 W 38–6 Spectrum Sports, MW App
At UNLV Rebels Friday, Nov. 21 10:30 p.m. FS1
Wyoming Cowboys Saturday, Nov. 29 11:00 p.m. Spectrum Sports, MW App

Best TV plans for watching Hawaii football

Spectrum TV
Editorial rating (3.6/5)
Price:
$40.00–$110.00/mo.
Channels:
150–160+
Features:
Complimentary streaming subscriptions in select plans
View Plans for Spectrum
Read Spectrum TV review

Data effective as of post date. Offers and availability may vary by location and are subject to change.

Watching Hawaii football requires a unique TV setup due to the team’s broadcast deal with Spectrum Sports. That said, the best plan for you will depend on whether you live in Hawaii or are following the team from out of state.

For fans in Hawaii

If you live in Hawaii, your most straightforward option is a Spectrum TV package. Because Spectrum holds the exclusive rights to several games, a Spectrum TV or Hawaiian Telcom subscription is the only way to guarantee you can watch every game in one service.

And in huge news for the 2025 season, the university has eliminated the pay-per-view package for home games. That means fans no longer have to shell out nearly $300 for a season package or $70 per game. Instead, six home games and the road game at Colorado State will be broadcast live and at no extra cost on Spectrum Sports.

For fans outside of Hawaii

For out-of-state fans, the best setup is a combination of a live TV streaming service and the official Mountain West app.

Hulu + Live TV is our top recommendation for college football due to its comprehensive channel lineup, featuring CBS Sports, ESPN, FOX Sports, and TNT Sports channels. Subscribers also get ESPN+ at no extra charge and unlimited DVR storage.

To watch the games that are exclusive to Spectrum Sports in Hawaii, you can stream them for free using the Mountain West app. Personally, I find this to be a step up from the Team1 Sports app, which streamed out-of-market Hawaii football games last season. The Mountain West app is available on mobile phones and smart TVs. And based on its App Store and Google Play reviews, it’s a much-needed upgrade from what Team1 Sports offered.

Find the best service in your area

Enter your zip code below to see your area’s top TV providers.

How to watch Hawaii Rainbow Warriors football FAQ

Where can I watch Hawaii football for free?

You can stream Hawaii Rainbow Warriors games with a DIRECTV free trial, but be aware of local blackouts and games exclusive to other platforms. You can also watch any college football games airing on local over-the-air stations (ABC, CBS, FOX, The CW, etc.) for free using a digital antenna.

Where can I stream Hawaii football games if I don’t have cable?

My favorite way to watch the Rainbow Warriors without cable is through Hulu + Live TV because it carries the main college football channels and includes ESPN+. But for games that air exclusively on Spectrum Sports, local fans will need an eligible Spectrum TV or Hawaiian Telcom plan, while fans on the mainland can stream them on the Mountain West app.

How do I watch Hawaii football if I live out of state?

For out-of-state fans, almost half of the Rainbow Warriors’ games air nationally, so a good live TV streaming service will have you covered. The remaining games are Spectrum Sports exclusives, which out-of-state fans can stream through the Mountain Sports app.

Can I watch Hawaii football on ESPN+?

The Hawaii Rainbow Warriors occasionally appear on ESPN+ in non-conference matchups. But most Hawaii football games are broadcast on Spectrum Sports, CBS Sports, and FOX Sports channels due to current broadcast deals involving the team and the Mountain West Conference.

Why you should trust us

Our CableTV.com Sports Editor, Taylor Kujawa, cross-referenced the official Hawaii Rainbow Warriors football schedule with the channel lineups of every major TV provider. Using those details, he selected our viewing recommendations based on channel availability, pricing, and ease of use.

This guide is updated regularly throughout the season to ensure our information is accurate. To learn more about our methods, check out our How We Rank page.

Game day starts here!

item.title: How To Watch the 2025 NWSL Playoffs: Updated Bracket & Semifinal TV Guide
item.dc:creator: Taylor Kujawa
item.description:
The 2025 NWSL Playoffs are here, and the latest media deal has spread the games across various broadcasters. Here's our expert guide on how to watch every match on TV.

The post How To Watch the 2025 NWSL Playoffs: Updated Bracket & Semifinal TV Guide appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
The 2025 NWSL Playoffs quarterfinals are in the books, and the semifinal bracket is now set. The weekend was packed with drama, as the Orlando Pride began their title defense by shutting out Seattle, and the Washington Spirit survived a penalty shootout against Racing Louisville.

Things got really wild on Sunday. Gotham FC pulled off the upset of the tournament, taking down the NWSL Shield-winning Kansas City Current. Then, the Portland Thorns took care of business against San Diego at the always raucous Providence Park.

To help you follow every remaining moment, I’ve put together this complete guide on how to watch the 2025 NWSL Playoffs. Keep scrolling for the full TV schedule and my expert breakdown of the best (and cheapest) TV plans for tuning in.

Jump to:

  • NWSL Playoffs TV schedule
  • Best NWSL Playoffs TV plans
  • Watch the NWSL Playoffs for free

Upgrade your TV plan for the NWSL Playoffs!

Enter your zip code below to see your area’s best TV and internet providers.

What channels show the NWSL Playoffs?

You’ll need access to at least three different channels and platforms to watch the complete 2025 NWSL Playoffs.

  • ABC (2 quarterfinals, 1 semifinal)
  • Amazon Prime Video (1 quarterfinal)
  • CBS (1 quarterfinal, 1 semifinal, and the NWSL Championship)

Pro tip: Games airing on ABC will stream simultaneously on ESPN+ via the new ESPN Select/Unlimited platform. Meanwhile, all games airing on CBS will stream live on Paramount+ Premium.

2025 NWSL Playoffs TV schedule

This year’s NWSL playoff format is all about high-stakes drama. We’ve got the top eight teams in a single-elimination tournament, and my favorite part of this setup? The top-seeded teams don’t get a bye, meaning every club enters the must-win chaos from the start.

Check out the full 2025 NWSL playoff schedule below to find all game times and channel listings.

Game Date Time (ET) Channels
Quarterfinals
(5) Seattle Reign at (4) Orlando Pride Friday, Nov. 7 8:00 p.m. Amazon Prime Video
(7) Racing Louisville at (2) Washington Spirit Saturday, Nov. 8 Noon CBS, Paramount+
(8) Gotham FC at (1) Kansas City Current Sunday, Nov. 9 12:30 p.m. ABC, ESPN+
(6) San Diego Wave at (3) Portland Thorns Sunday, Nov. 9 3:00 p.m. ABC, ESPN+
Semifinals
(3) Portland Thorns at (2) Washington Spirit Saturday, Nov. 15 Noon CBS, Paramount+
(8) Gotham FC at (4) Orlando Pride Sunday, Nov. 16 3:00 p.m. ABC, ESPN+
NWSL Championship
TBD Saturday, Nov. 22 8:00 p.m. CBS, Paramount+

Data effective as of post date.

Best TV plans for watching the NWSL Playoffs

If you’ve been watching the NWSL all season, you likely already have access to every playoff channel. But if you’re just joining in, you’ll need a clear viewing strategy. That’s because no single TV service includes ABC, CBS, and Amazon Prime Video.

The most straightforward way to watch every playoff game is to build your own “à la carte” streaming bundle. You’ll need three separate subscriptions: Prime Video (for the Prime-exclusive quarterfinal), a Paramount+ Premium plan (for all the CBS games), and an ESPN Select subscription (which gets you the ESPN+ simulcasts of the ABC games). This entire setup will cost you around $35 a month, and you can cancel everything right after the championship.

There’s also one other, even cheaper way to watch most of the games. Since the ABC and CBS matches are on broadcast TV, a digital antenna can get you six of the seven playoff games for free. I cover that viewing method in more detail in the Watch for Free section below.

Which TV providers carry the NWSL Playoffs?

For those who prefer the traditional cable or satellite route, you’re still in good shape. You’ll need a separate subscription for the Prime Video match, but most major TV providers (like DIRECTV, Spectrum, and Xfinity) carry both ABC and CBS.

To simplify things, I’ve broken down the channel availability for 13 popular services in the table below.

Score the best TV service in your area

Not every TV provider is available nationwide. Enter your zip code below to find the best NWSL viewing options for your home turf.

How to watch the NWSL Playoffs for free

You have two fantastic strategies for watching the NWSL Playoffs for free: using a digital antenna and taking advantage of free trials.

I prefer using an antenna because I live within range of my local ABC and CBS affiliates, which will show six of the seven playoff games. An antenna is a simple, one-time purchase that gets you the vast majority of the tournament for free. You just need to live within a 70-mile radius of an affiliate and have no major physical obstructions near your home.

Heads up: Before you buy an antenna, I recommend using the FCC’s Reception Map Tool or Antennas Direct’s TV Transmitter Locator to see which channels are available near you.

For the one quarterfinal that streams exclusively on Prime Video, your best bet is to sign up for the service’s 30-day free trial. Live TV streaming services like DIRECTV and Fubo also offer free trials to pick up ABC and CBS if the antenna method doesn’t work for you.

How to watch the NWSL Playoffs FAQ

How many teams go to the NWSL Playoffs?

The top eight NWSL teams, based on the final regular-season standings, qualify for the playoffs. The league expanded its postseason format in 2024 to coincide with the introduction of expansion teams Bay FC and the Utah Royals.

What channel is the NWSL Championship Game on?

The 2025 NWSL Championship will air on CBS on Saturday, November 22, at 8:00 p.m. ET. You can also stream the game live on Paramount+ Premium.

How can I watch the NWSL Playoffs internationally?

Internationally, NWSL playoff matches will mainly stream for free on NWSL+. But the league has global media partnerships in certain countries and territories that may impact NWSL+ access. For example, TNT Sports will air all playoff games in the U.K.

Can I watch the NWSL Playoffs on Paramount+?

Yes, you can watch three NWSL playoff games on Paramount+. The service's higher-tier Premium plan will stream every playoff match that airs on CBS, which includes one quarterfinal, one semifinal, and the NWSL Championship.

Why you should trust us

Our CableTV.com Sports Editor, Taylor Kujawa, has been an avid follower of the NWSL since 2016 and has been covering the league professionally since 2019. For this guide, he combined that deep fan perspective with hours of expert research, cross-referencing the official 2025 playoff bracket with the channel lineups of every major TV provider. Taylor based his recommendations on finding the most cost-effective and convenient ways for you to watch every single match.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

Game day starts here!

Peacock is a must-have streaming service for soccer fans in the U.S. to watch the English Premier League (EPL). Just under half of the league’s 380 games stream exclusively on Peacock, with NBC match simulcasts also available on the service. But you’ll need USA Network to catch other matches not streaming on Peacock.

To get Peacock, you must subscribe to one of its premium plans—starting at $10.99 a month. Not only will you receive around 175 live Premier League games per season, but you’ll also have thousands of movies and TV shows at your fingertips. As for USA Network, you’ll need a cable, satellite, or live TV streaming plan to pick up the channel.

Keep reading to learn more about how to watch the Premier League in the U.S. We update this guide regularly with the league’s U.S. TV schedule and channel listings to help you tune in.

Jump to:

  • Premier League channels
  • Premier League TV schedule
  • Best Premier League TV plans
  • Watch the Premier League for free

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event-viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

What channels show Premier League games?

Premier League fans in the U.S. can watch every match across NBC, Peacock, and USA Network. If you prefer Spanish-language commentary, Telemundo, UNIVERSO, and Peacock carry select games en Español.

Some matches may appear on other NBCUniversal networks, such as CNBC, Golf Channel, and Syfy, especially on Championship Sunday. But Peacock often simultaneously streams those games and all matches that air on NBC.

Pro tip: Fans of England women’s soccer can catch many Women’s Super League and Women’s Championship matches on the Barclays WSL and Barclays WC YouTube channels. Some WSL games also stream on ESPN+.

Premier League TV schedule

The 2025–2026 Premier League season began on August 15, 2025, and wrap up with Championship Sunday on May 24, 2026. Keep in mind that all match times are subject to change due to cup competitions and weather, which is why we update this section nearly every week of the season.

Below, you’ll find a list of the upcoming matchday fixtures with U.S. kickoff times and channel listings. You can also visit the official Premier League Matches webpage to see the entire calendar.

Data effective as of post date.

Best TV plans for watching the Premier League

Peacock is an essential part of watching the Premier League in the U.S. Yet, to enjoy every game this season, you must supplement Peacock with a TV provider that carries USA Network.

Fortunately, Peacock is an inexpensive service. Its premium plans start at $10.99/mo., and grant you access to nearly half of this season’s Premier League games. On top of that, Peacock includes thousands of movies and TV shows alongside additional live sports. We’re talking NFL, Premiership Rugby, and WWE events. You even get complete Spanish-language access to the FIFA World Cup and FIFA Women’s World Cup each time those tournaments come around.

The cheapest way to get USA Network is through Sling TV. The live TV streaming service offers the channel in its Sling Blue plan for $45.99/mo. But if you have more room in your budget, Hulu + Live TV also has NBC Sports channels and includes ESPN+ at no extra cost—giving you live FA Cup, La Liga, and Bundesliga games. Unfortunately, you’ll also need Paramount+ in your streaming roster if you want robust EFL Championship and League One coverage.

What TV providers carry Premier League games?

Most cable, satellite, and live TV streaming services carry Premier League games via NBC, CNBC, and USA Network. But as shown in our table below, some providers don’t have any NBCUniversal channels.

Premier League content on Peacock

Peacock has a wealth of Premier League content. It streams around 175 live games and occasionally offers multiview coverage. With Peacock, you can also watch on-demand replays of all 380 league matchups each season. Replays of games that didn’t originally air live on Peacock become available 24 hours after the match ends and are available to stream for 30 days.

Outside of actual games, Peacock is also home to Premier League studio shows, highlights, and docuseries. There’s even a 24/7 live channel called Premier League TV that really comes in handy on transfer deadline days.

What’s great about Premier League TV is that it airs a mixture of U.S.- and U.K.-produced content. This means you’ll get the best of both worlds with NBC Sports and Sky Sports programming. We particularly enjoy The Kelly & Wrighty Show, which features presenter Kelly Cates and Arsenal legend Ian Wright.

Here’s a list of Premier League programs featured on Peacock:

You can watch Premier League games free in the U.S. using an over-the-air (OTA) antenna to pick up your local NBC or Telemundo station. Unfortunately, neither channel is available in every corner of the country. But you can use the FCC’s Reception Map Tool to verify if they’re within range.

There isn’t a free way to access Premier League games on Peacock. However, you can sign up for a live TV streaming trial to watch games on NBC and USA Network without paying. Fubo offers a seven-day free trial and provides access to both channels.

How to watch the Premier League FAQ

Is the Premier League free on Peacock?

No, the Premier League is not free on Peacock. To watch live Premier League matches on Peacock, you must subscribe to one of its premium plans (starting at $10.99 a month).

Does Peacock Premium have all Premier League games?

No, Peacock Premium doesn’t have all Premier League games available to stream live—but it does have every game available to stream on demand. Games that don’t appear live on Peacock will air on USA Network or CNBC for English-language coverage and UNIVERSO for Spanish-language coverage. These games will become available as full match replays on Peacock 24 hours after they end.

Do Peacock ads interrupt Premier League games?

No, ads don’t interrupt ongoing Premier League matches. You’ll see commercials before and after each half, regardless of whether you subscribe to the ad-based Peacock Premium ($10.99 a month) or the ad-free Peacock Premium Plus ($16.99 a month).

What app has Premier League games?

You can catch live Premier League games on the Peacock app and the NBC Sports app. You’ll need a Peacock Premium subscription to watch Premier League games on the Peacock app, while the NBC Sports app requires you to log in with your TV provider’s credentials.

Why you should trust us

Our CableTV.com Sports Editor, Taylor Kujawa, has been an avid Premier League fan for over a decade. He deeply understands the main frustration for U.S. fans: the weekly channel shuffle between NBC, USA Network, and Peacock.

To create this guide, Taylor combined his hands-on experience as a Peacock subscriber with research into NBC Sports’ U.S. broadcast deal (which runs through the 2027–2028 season). He also compared Peacock’s value and Premier League game count with traditional TV options.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

item.title: Your Ultimate Guide To Watching Liverpool FC in the US
item.dc:creator: Taylor Kujawa
item.description:
If you’re looking to watch Liverpool today, you’re in for another thrilling chapter of Reds football. The 2025–2026 season should be an exhilarating one under second-year head coach Arne Slot.

The post Your Ultimate Guide To Watching Liverpool FC in the US appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
If you’re looking to watch Liverpool today, you’re in for another thrilling chapter of Reds football. Last season was one for the ages, as head coach Arne Slot steered Liverpool to its 20th English league title. Sure, there’ll never be anything quite like Jürgen Klopp and his heavy-metal football. But LFC is still appointment viewing.

With Liverpool playing in multiple competitions, U.S. fans must navigate several viewing options to catch every match live. Premier League games air on NBC Sports platforms, while CBS Sports holds the U.S. rights to the UEFA Champions League. But that’s only part of the picture.

Below, I break down the best ways to watch Liverpool on TV in the U.S. From live TV services to streaming-only options, this guide covers everything you need to keep up with the Reds this season.

Jump to:

  • Liverpool FC channels
  • Liverpool TV schedule
  • Best Liverpool TV plans
  • LFCTV plans and prices

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event-viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

What channel is Liverpool on in the US?

Liverpool TV channels vary game-to-game in the U.S. based on the competition. You’ll need NBC, Peacock, and USA Network for Premier League match days, while Paramount+ is a must-have for UEFA Champions League and EFL Cup (Carabao Cup) games.

FA Cup games stream on ESPN+. Let’s just hope Liverpool make it further than the Fourth Round this season.

Want coverage en Español? Select Liverpool EPL games air with Spanish-language commentary on Telemundo, UNIVERSO, and Peacock. Meanwhile, you can stream all Champions League matches in Spanish on ViX.

Upcoming Liverpool TV schedule across all competitions

The 2025–2026 Liverpool FC season is in full swing, and it’s a busy one. The Reds are competing for titles across multiple fronts, including a packed schedule of matches in the Premier League, Champions League, and FA Cup. Unfortunately, Crystal Palace knocked Liverpool out of the EFL Cup in late October.

Check out the TV schedule below for the next ten upcoming LFC fixtures and U.S. channel listings.

Opponent Competition Day Time (ET) Channels
Nottingham Forest Premier League Saturday, Nov. 22 10:00 a.m. TBA
PSV Champions League Wednesday, Nov. 26 3:00 p.m. Paramount+
At West Ham United Premier League Sunday, Nov. 30 9:05 a.m. TBA
Sunderland Premier League Wednesday, Dec. 3 3:15 p.m. TBA
At Leeds United Premier League Saturday, Dec. 6 12:30 p.m. TBA
At Inter Milan Champions League Tuesday, Dec. 9 3:00 p.m. Paramount+
Brighton & Hove Albion Premier League Saturday, Dec. 13 10:00 a.m. TBA
At Tottenham Hotspur Premier League Saturday, Dec. 20 12:30 p.m. TBA
Wolverhampton Wanderers Premier League Saturday, Dec. 27 10:00 a.m. TBA
Leeds United Premier League Thursday, Jan. 1 12:30 p.m. TBA

Data effective as of post date.

Best Liverpool TV plans for watching the most matches

Now that you know Liverpool’s U.S. TV channels and match schedule, it’s time to explore the best TV plans for watching the Reds.

Ultimately, you’ll need Peacock, Paramount+, and a live TV provider to tune in. But spending around $100 a month on TV services isn’t ideal for everyone. If that’s outside your budget, check the schedule above to prioritize the matches that matter most to you.

Peacock Premium ($10.99–$16.99/mo.)

Nearly half of the English Premier League’s matches stream exclusively on Peacock Premium, including several Liverpool games. In other words, there’s no way around this recommendation. You simply need Peacock if you’re a Liverpool fan.

The NBCUniversal streaming service carries 175 live Premier League games per season, including Peacock exclusives and NBC match simulcasts. But many matches will air on USA Network, which requires a cable, satellite, or live TV streaming service to watch.

One standout feature of Peacock is the ability to watch Premier League replays on demand for up to 30 days. It also offers league highlights, studio shows, and documentaries, making it a solid option for Liverpool fans to stay connected all season.

Paramount+ ($7.99–$12.99/mo.)

Paramount+ is a must-have for watching every UEFA Champions League game. Apart from the European Cup, the streaming service also carries live Europa League, EFL Cup, Serie A, and NWSL matches.

I’ve been a Paramount+ subscriber since day one, and its soccer coverage keeps me hooked. But there’s plenty to watch between match days, from hit movies to binge-worthy TV shows. Best of all, you can test it out with a seven-day free trial before deciding if it’s right for you.

Hulu + Live TV ($88.99–$99.99/mo.)

Beyond Peacock and Paramount+, you’ll need a live TV service to watch Liverpool games on USA Network. While Sling TV offers the cheapest access, I recommend Hulu + Live TV for its robust lineup of CBS Sports, ESPN, FOX Sports, NBC Sports, and TNT Sports channels. Plus, its convenient My Stuff watchlist lets you easily track upcoming games not on Peacock or Paramount+.

Hulu + Live TV also includes ESPN+ at no extra cost. That means you can watch all FA Cup, La Liga, and Bundesliga matches, along with select Women’s Super League games featuring Liverpool FC Women. And with unlimited DVR storage, you won’t miss those early-morning kickoffs in the U.S.

Level up your streaming experience!

Your internet must be as fast and reliable as Mohamed Salah to enjoy smooth streaming on game day. Enter your zip code below to find top internet providers in your area.

Everything you need to know about LFCTV

LFCTV is Liverpool FC’s official TV subscription service that features exclusive club content. In the U.K., it’s available as an add-on via Sky and Virgin Media, while U.S. fans can subscribe online through All Red Video (formerly LFCTV GO).

At just $6.49 per month, All Red Video offers one plan that includes full-match replays, extended highlights, behind-the-scenes features, and exclusive interviews. All you need is a free MyLFC account to get started—and you can score your first month free with promo code ARFREE25. All Red Video works via the LFCTV GO app on platforms like Roku, Amazon Fire TV, Android TV, and mobile devices.

In my experience, All Red Video shines brightest during the preseason, when it’s often the only place to watch live Liverpool matches. It’s also a reliable platform for streaming entire game replays without juggling multiple services. But it’s not super necessary during the regular season if you already have Peacock and Paramount+ subscriptions.

How to watch Liverpool FAQ

How can I watch Liverpool today for free?

You can watch Liverpool matches for free in a few ways, depending on the competition. Games airing on NBC or CBS are accessible with a digital antenna. Meanwhile, streaming services such as DIRECTV and Fubo offer free trials for watching matches on cable channels like USA Network or CBS Sports Network. Unfortunately, Peacock doesn’t have a free trial, but Paramount+ does.

Does Peacock have every Liverpool game?

No, Peacock streams less than half of Liverpool’s Premier League games live. You’ll need a TV provider that includes USA Network to watch the club’s other Premier League matchups.

How can I watch Liverpool’s FA Cup and EFL Cup games?

In the U.S., all of Liverpool’s FA Cup matches stream live on ESPN+. EFL Cup games are available on Paramount+ and may also air on channels like CBS Sports Network and CBS Sports Golazo Network.

How can I watch classic Liverpool matches on demand?

LFCTV offers full-match replays from the past 10 years, including select classic games like the iconic 2005 UCL Final. Additionally, you can find classic matches, highlights, and season reviews on YouTube for a closer look at Liverpool’s storied history.

What radio station is the Liverpool game on?

SiriusXM FC (ch. 157) carries live radio coverage of select Liverpool Premier League and Champions League matches in the U.S. You can also stream game day audio from Liverpool’s in-house commentary crew with a free MyLFC account or a paid All Red Video subscription. Heads up: BBC Radio 5’s coverage isn’t available in the U.S. without using a VPN to bypass territory restrictions.

Where can I watch Liverpool FC Legends games?

You can typically watch all Liverpool charity matches on All Red Video, while some LFC Legends games also stream on the club’s official Facebook page and YouTube channel.

Will Liverpool play in the US in 2025?

No, Liverpool won’t play in the U.S. this year, as the team will spend the bulk of its 2025 preseason in Asia. LFC typically alternates between Asia and North America for preseason tours. After visiting the U.S. in 2024, an Asia-based preseason seems the most likely for 2025.

Why you should trust us

Our CableTV.com Sports Editor, Taylor Kujawa, compiled a list of all upcoming Liverpool FC matches and researched U.S. broadcast options. Using that data, he evaluated the best ways to watch Liverpool on TV in the U.S. based on game availability, pricing, and ease of use. Taylor then cross-referenced his findings with CableTV.com’s extensive sports and TV coverage to ensure accurate and reliable recommendations.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

Game day starts here!
